intro: Machaerina disticha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense spikes. Machaerina disticha is often found in damp, shaded areas such as forests and stream sides.
